title: Félix Delamarche
text:
Félix Delamarche was a French <a href="geographer">geographer</a> and <a href="engineer">engineer</a> who flourished during the 18th century and early 19th century. His father was the map publisher <a href="Charles%20Francois%20Delamarche">Charles Francois Delamarche</a>.
Félix Delamarche became the owner of his father's map publishing company, Maison Delamarche. He ran the company alongside <a href="cartographer">cartographer</a> <a href="Charles%20Dien">Charles Dien</a>. The firm would eventually be passed down to Alexandre Delamarche. Delamarche created "Atlas de la géographie ancienne et moderne" in 1820. The <a href="atlas">atlas</a> was reprinted during the 19th century. It was utilized by the <a href="Ecole%20Sp%C3%A9ciale%20Militaire%20de%20Saint-Cyr">Ecole Spéciale Militaire de Saint-Cyr</a>. His work is held in the collection of the <a href="Library%20of%20Congress">Library of Congress</a>.
